subHeader: To know how FusionCharts works, it is important to understand the various components and concepts of a chart

content.header: Below are different sections with interactive annotated images describing various components and concepts of charts

annotations.annotationDesc: The caption (also called the gauge title) is the heading of your gauge. You can add custom text for the caption, as well as configure its font properties and cosmetics.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize font properties and cosmetics of caption using attributes. Know more about them.
You can also customize the alignment of the caption. Learn more about it

annotations.annotationDesc: The sub-caption (also called the gauge subtitle) is the sub-heading of your gauge. You can add custom text for sub-caption, as well as configure its font properties.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: Font properties and cosmetics of sub-caption can also be customized using attributes, learn more about them

annotations.annotationDesc: Canvas area refers to the area in which the gauge data is plotted, excluding the area where titles, legends, and axis names are rendered.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize border for canvas, learn more about it
You can customize background color for canvas, as well as add gradient fill to it. Learn more about it

annotations.annotationDesc: X-Axis refers to line or values on a gauge that runs horizontally (left-right). Learn more about it
X-Axis labels are the names of the data points that are displayed on the x-axis of a gauge. Learn more about it
Y-Axis refers to a line of values on a gauge that runs vertically (up-down) through zero. Learn more about them
Y-Axis refers to the title of the y-axis. Learn more about it
Data plot refers to the columns of the dial in an angular gauge, the sphere in a bulb gauge, the thermometer in a thermometer gauge, and so on.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize the way your data plot looks using colors, gradients and hover effects using available attributes, learn more about their usage

annotations.annotationDesc: A tooltip is displayed when the mouse cursor hovers over a particular data point. It denotes valuable information about the data plot hovered.

annotationLinks.linkDesc: You can customize padding, size and other properties of tooltip, learn more about it
You can also customize the text of tooltip and use values plotted on the gauge using macros, learn more about it
